column5: Hey guys, as the season draws down I thought you guys would like to see two hawgs we took this year, one 2 days after opener and the other today. The first was 50X26 and todays was 56X23 1/2. Both fish come jigging deep in the Detroit River!
Here is the other!!!
That thing looks like it just ate a small dog
Holy Crap those are some nice musky. I hope to get some like those in the future.
I'd soil my knickers if i hooked into something that size
He almost did. He might have soiled himself actually cause we went in 1 hour later..
Musky god seems very happy with you

holy! are those dimensions right though? 23 seems a little "skinny" on the second fish. Then again, if you're 56 long maybe its just a long "thin" fish. Just seems disproportionate for this time of year...then again what the heck do I know about a 56 inch musky! 2 awesome specimens
Man I gotta get on that jigging bite on the St.Lawrence...
Huge! nice fish!
WOW  Beauty for sure.  congrats
I'd trade my Wife for that beast!    Did I just say that out loud?
WOW...!!!!   they are huge....incredible fish man congrats
Nice 'skis!! They are big and chunky. Good to see your style of fishing produces. Good for you.
Some really nice fish there. Jon. Congrats to you.
A couple of very impressive fish indeed !!

Congratulations for sure. Two absolute trophies in the same season! That's inspiration for the rest of us to see that such fantastic fish are still alive and well so close to home! Thank you very much for sharing!
O my god..  Nice tanks Bondy!
awesome skis
Great job Jon, you are really putting your cients on some giants this fall WTG!!
Is that the best you can do....sheesh???? hahahaha  Awesome fish man!!!
WOwwwwwwwwiiiiiiiiieeeee, what a couple of monsters.   What a thrill that must have been.  Congrats

WOW!  I was just introduced to the LSC fishery this year and I can say that I will be heading down there several times a year for the forseable future.  Awesome musky fishery and the bondy bait really excels there.  Great job!
Thanks all....went 3 for 5 today dodging the waves and flurries.
